description: Borrowed from Spanish alcaide, from Arabic الْقَائِد‎ (al-qāʔid, “leader”); compare caid.

entries.meaning: The governor or commander of a Spanish or Portuguese fortress or prison.
examples: Soon after Mr. Petticrew arrived at Gibraltar, he came to Tetuan in his majeſty's ſhip Seahorſe, to acquaint the alcaide that he had orders from the king of Great Britain, […] .
